column4: I just had to rearrange my drives because of an IRQ conflict on the machine, and ubuntu kernel panics when booting.  Can someone help me repoint tings to the right drive?
try using your live disk and typing "rescue"
it'll ask you which drive to mount as root... if you get it wrong just keep on using that live disk.
- thanks a lot
np.
- it says "could not find kernel image: rescue" from the live CD
sorry I was unclear. I meant your install cd.
- any help on how to change my boot partition?
are you in the install cd's rescue mode?
- yeah
you want to change your boot partition to another partition?
- I moved the drive... so yes
the easiest way is to use grub-install /dev/[drive here]
mount it and then take a look around. ;-)
- good point
- grub-install takes /dev/hdb or /dev/hdb1 ?
It's been awhile but I'd say /dev/hdb1. If you give me a second I can check.
- any luck?
I think you'd go with hda not hda1 (or whatever you mentioned)
- ok...  it says "the file /boot/grub/stage1 not read correctly ?
then try hda1 or whatever it was. =)
thanks for your help, but I jhave to go.
np. Get anything figured out?
- not yet...
